definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: You have one where you have almost only pirates in there.
sentences.chinese: 有一家只招待海盜的酒吧。

sentences.english: The pirate Modi did not like shots.
Piracy is alive and flourishing on the world's commercial sea-lanes.
sentences.chinese: 海盜行爲在世界各地的商運航線上很猖獗。

sentences.english: They raised the pirate flag, with its picture of a skull and crossed bones.
sentences.chinese: 他們升起海盜旗，上面畫着骷髏頭和交叉的兩把刀。

sentences.english: Jack and the other men were hanged.
sentences.chinese: 傑克和其他男海盜都被處絞刑。

sentences.english: "Well, " says the pirate, "it was my first day with the hook. "
sentences.chinese: “那是在我換上勾子的第一天，”海盜說。

sentences.english: A gun like this would also be useful for stopping pirate attacks against commercial shipping.
sentences.chinese: 像這樣的電磁炮同樣也可用於阻止海盜襲擊商用船隻。

sentences.english: The doomed pirate in the crow's nest had been right.
sentences.chinese: 那個在瞭望臺上也難逃一死的海盜是對的。

sentences.english: Pirate crews followed a set of rules called the Code of Conduct.
sentences.chinese: 海盜成員遵循着一套叫做“行爲法典”的規則。

sentences.english: The little ship tried to escape when the big pirate ship bore down on it.
sentences.chinese: 那條大海盜船逐漸逼近時，小船力圖擺脫。

sentences.english: From Hobyo's beach, three different ships captured by the pirates can be seen.
sentences.chinese: 從霍比亞海灘可以看到三艘被海盜攔劫的船。

sentences.english: That day was hastened when the sea-brigands of Somalia caught Chinese vessels, cargoes and sailors in the net of their brazen raids.
sentences.chinese: 當索馬里海盜綁架中國船隻，那一天加速到來。

sentences.english: Hanging pirates from the yardarm is so 18th-century.
sentences.chinese: 在18世紀你可以把海盜系在桁杆上吊死。

sentences.english: Terror-stricken, the pirates ordered everybody to go on board.
sentences.chinese: 惶恐之中，海盜命令大家上船。

sentences.english: And now pirates are branching out onto land.
sentences.chinese: 而如今，海盜正在將勢力範圍延伸到陸地。

sentences.english: Security companies may be ill-equipped to deal with pirates;
sentences.chinese: 對付海盜，安防公司也可能會裝備不良。
